abstracts.cdata!:
On balance, the project gave mixed
            results, for its outcome is unsatisfactory, due to the
            negative first six years of project implementation.
            Nonetheless, the performance of the Bank was satisfactory,
            sustainability likely given the high priority, and political
            commitment of the current government to universal basic
            education, and, institutional development impacts were
            modest. However, the Borrower's performance is
            unsatisfactory, given the detrimental effects of governance
            issues, and deep shortfall of counterpart funding. Lessons
            indicate that implementation of basic services projects,
            within a general climate of lack of support from government,
            and overall deterioration in the country, will only result
            in minimal gains. Thus, access to, and quality of education
            did not improve during implementation, rather the project
            only laid the foundation for improvements. In an overall
            environment of strong centralization, poor governance, and
            loss of trust in Government, the most successful
            interventions were those with substantial involvement from
            communities. Similarly, the use of alternative institutions
            - parastatals - for service delivery, may be the most
            effective way to achieve results in an environment as
            previously described, but it is difficult to reverse once in
            place, for in the long run, regular line agencies become
            substantially weakened, and require further restructuring,
            and strengthening. Unfortunately, the improved project
            performance during the last three years, did not reverse the
            initial decline, and, extension of the closing date only
            prolonged an unsatisfactory performance.
